author: Andrew Beaton
title: Prosecutors Expand Corruption Investigation of NCAA Basketball
text:
The federal probe that rocked college basketball this season expanded its scope Tuesday, as prosecutors named four Division I schools, including league powerhouse Kansas, in a new indictment alleging corruption in the sport.
The Manhattan U.S. attorneyâ€™s office alleges that an Adidas AG executive worked with others to make illegal payments to the families of six players in connection with their decisions to play at the University of Louisville, the University of Miami, the University of Kansas and North Carolina State University....
